reviews.review_msg: lectures may be boring and monotonic. but it is worth to go to class because she would give some hint on midterm questions. The midterm was not hard but it is based on concept and too long. at last she allowed a double-sided cheatsheet in final exam which reduces the memorization part. the questions stay very close to the practice final. recommend.

Good lectures with clear explanations at a reasonable pace. Supplemented us with previous year's notes which were also helpful. Homework was relatively long and difficult but always built off lecture content. Exams are fair if you're caught up and have done the practices. Overall, it's a relatively challenging but rewarding and well-executed course

good lectures, explanations are clear and to the point, confident with the topics, really puts an effort to make sure everyone passes, only problem is he sometimes shows up lates and definitely doesn't end lecture on time. overall very good and recommended
very enthusiastic lectures, this class is like a dream. Thank you Dr. Wittenberg

Never take Math 314 with this professor. It seemed as if I took a Physics class rather than a Maths class. Exams are super lengthy (did not even reach the last question worth 20 marks) , assignments are super length (almost took 2 days to complete the assignment). Worst Maths prof ever.

Took 2 classes with Ralf. He's super kind and a very good teacher. If you're an advanced student, you might find that he progresses slowly and perhaps repeats himself too much, but don't worry; you won't find his assessments too easy! Exams are long, but everything works out if you've been putting in the effort.  Overall, excellent.

It was the worst quality course I had in SFU so far: she was coming often unprepared for the lectures, messed up theorems, examples. It looked like she did not care what she was doing in this course. She was even half an hour late for the exam. Not good.

The midterm was too lengthy, just like the lectures. John tries to squeeze too much material in each lecture. The grading for the exams seemed to weigh the final answer more than the approach used. Assignments are bi-weekly, the math portion is of reasonable length and requires one to play with given Matlab codes. Be prepared to hear ARGH!! UGHH!!!

greatest TA i ever had. solid, smart, responsive to email, detailed assignment solns step by step procedure worked on. his marking scheme is giving fair partmark (make sure you complete everything do not leave blank).i think he did a better job than the prof since the way he explained things is concrete. looking forward to his future courses in SFU

Not very clear, does too much theory, and when she does do examples she skips a lot of steps, so you better have understood them the first time.  Tests were very hard, and she would not offer any alternate grading scheme so even if you work hard and learn the material by the end, it won't help you if you did bad on previous tests/homework.
Extremely clear and thorough lectures. Homework could be long and hard. Exams were fair.

Extremely picky when it comes to grading. Whole course feels like you're being punished from not getting it rather than reaching out to students and helping them learn. Course would've been better if he acquired some educational knowledge.

His notes are extremely unclear and unreadable outside of class. Exams are hard and he is very picky when it comes to marking. You get this feeling that he is just teaching because it's his job, not because he likes it. He seemed to be unfamiliar with the homework he assigned, and lecture will leave you confused.
Really easy to get lost during lectures, and he seems to think everything is trivially easy.

Dr. Fetecau is extremely well-versed in the subjects he lectures, which permits a more penetrating investigation of the material. His courses are very well structured and immerse you in a mathematical journey. Very good prof

Notes is ok. Helpful/Nice. But MT/Final is very HARD AND CRAZY!!He expect u write everything down without thinking! Questions is UNBELIEVABLE(Qs may from text/note, but u never expect). Also Qs is very LONG, u Never have time to do. Taking his course, GOOD LUCK!!!
Really hard class but really interesting. Very good professor
